fields.description:
1) Create bug
2) Close bug, write close reason in "comment" box on close dialog.
3) Realise close reason was intended for different bug
4) Kick self
5) Try to delete new "comment" (close reason)
6) Realise you cannot
7) Kick Atlassian

You should be able to edit bugs (delete comments, edit comments, undo closing [not the same as re-opening!]) without adding more history.

fields.description:
If the user creates an issue with an attachment and then attempts to create a subsequent issue (without an attachment), they get an error stating, "_Temporary attachment not found. Session may have timed out before submitting the form_". 

It looks like the file attachment data is getting carried forward from the previous issue. It appears this only occurs if the user opens the Create Issue form by right clicking on the "Create Issue" button and choosing the option to open it in a different browser tab (See Step to Repeat below).

Steps to Repeat:

# Create the first issue (with an attachment):
#* Right click on the "Create issue" button and choose the option to open it in a different browser tab.
#* Fill out the necessary fields on the new tab, attach a file, and submit the issue.
# Attempt to create the second issue (without an attachment):
#* Again, right click on the "Create issue" button and choose the option to open it in a different browser tab.
#* Go to the new tab and view the Attachment area. Notice the file attached to the previous issue is listed (For the purpose of this test, don't uncheck it).
#*  Fill out the necessary fields and submit the issue.
*RESULT*: The following error is thrown: "_Temporary attachment not found. Session may have timed out before submitting the form_"
fields.summary: File Attachment information is getting carried over on subsequent issue creates.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40833].
  {panel}

Currently a mailhandler tries to find the ticket in the summary of an email.

We have several mail handlers and had the problem that somebody forwarded a jira notification to a mail handler mail account. The mailhandler recognized the ticket and added a comment to the found ticket.

The expected behaviour was that a ticket was created in the default project.
But this shall not happen for all mails, sometimes (within the default project) a comment shall indeed be added to the ticket.

So we suggest an option in the mail handler config to select "Handler only for default project". If the ticket reference in the summary is found within the default project, a comment is added. If not, a new ticket is created, even if the named ticket exists already in Jira in a different project.
fields.summary: option for incoming mail handler to only create tickets in default project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40832].
  {panel}

Currently behaviour:
Send a mail containing two screenshots (not attachments but images inserted into the mail text(html)). Jira mailhandler inserted them into the ticket as attachments, both named "IMAGE.PNG". In the ticket description, there is text "1" and "2" where the images where.

Suggestion 1:
- each image the mailhandler attaches should get a unique name so it can be easily embedded in the description

Suggestion 2:
- instead of "1" and "2", the mailhandler should insert the "!imagename.png|thumbnail!" directive which leads to a thumbnail of the attached image
fields.summary: Unique names for attachments (images) attached by incoming mail handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40831].
  {panel}

It would be nice to get a confirmation of a creation of a ticket by a mail handler. Currently this can only be reached by setting the value of "Notify own changes" to True.
As a company that works much with Jira this is no option as many people would spam theirselfes.
So nearly everybode has set this option to False.

This results in writing an email to an account with configured mail handler and getting no notification. So nobody knows that a jira ticket was created until some action takes place in the ticket. And even if one knows that a Jira Ticket is created, one doesn't know the ticket ID for an additional info or question.

The suggestion is to make an additional checkbox for configuring the mail handler with name "Notify Reporter on Creation" with the meaning of new tickets that are created will trigger a notification to the reporter no matter what setting "Notify own changes" is made.
fields.summary: confirming notification of ticket creation by incoming mail handler
Issue Move Event when moving an issue to a Different Issue Type

fields.description:
Trac has changed the path for attachments, somewhere around 0.13 or 1.0...

It is now:
files/attachments/ticket/[first 3 digits of ticket id hash]/[full ticket id hash]/[filename hash].[original filename extension]

example for an attachment called "resize-error.png" to ticket #1189:
files/attachments/ticket/fdc/fdc01209f90eda589f0453b7e29e0114923ecd8b/c938eb2e1942386a45b1b8cdfce27a9f3d00f06f.png

This bug causes all errors for every ticket with an attachment when importing tickets from Trac to JIRA.
fields.summary: Trac importer does not use Trac's latest attachment path arrangement
ADFS support for single sign on please!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40815].
  {panel}

Hello,

I'd like to outline the workflow I use for upgrading JIRA on Windows and the frustrations I have with it for hopeful improvement.  I'm running the x64 installer on Windows Server 2012 R2.

1) Registration settings get removed during every upgrade yet Confluence persists them.  I have to set manual min and max memory and add a plug-in delay line to the java options.  I have to do this with every single JIRA upgrade but again, not with Confluence, it persists my values

2) You have a checkbox at the end of the JIRA install "Launch JIRA" which is not checked but the service IS started.  I don't want the service to start automatically when the JIRA update is complete as I have to go into the registry to and set the values again and also copy in my custom config file with my server alias, url, port, etc. 

3) If you detect a custom config file move it to a temp location, do the install, then rename the original .new and put my config file back in place so I don't have to do it every time.

With a little effort the upgrade process can be more seamless.  Leave the registry settings intact, don't start the service if I don't have the "Launch JIRA" checkbox checked on the last install wizard screen, and keep my customizations by putting them back after upgrade.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Post installation feedback and improvements

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new filter with name: *AA_1.6_Unresolved*
2. In existing dashboard, pick a gadget and try to change the filter to *AA_1.6_Unresolved*
3. typing in *AA_1.6* yields nothing. Nor does *1.6_Unresolved*. In fact, no matter what combination you try, you won't be able to select *AA_1.6_Unresolved* from the drop down menu. 

Customer Feedback: 
{quote}
Please reinstate the ability to select the filter in dashboard gadgets via a pop-up window! Recent updates made it impossible for me to select new filters, so I'm totally stuck right now!
{quote}

There are two issues in play:
#  Multiple filters that contain the name *Unresolved* doesn't show all available filters in autocomplete. 
# If a filter contains a dash followed by a number it won't be available in autocomplete. For example, the following filter name will cause an issue: {code}Filter-6{code} but {code}Filter - 6{code} and/or {code}Filter-Six{code} are perfectly fine. 

Ideally we can manually escape the characters as a workaround until this is fully resolved.

Sometimes, there are add-on modules that are disabled :

!module1.png|thumbnail!

Usually, they can be enabled by the user, and then be used without any problems. However, there are times when the module cannot be enabled, and says that it cannot be modified :

The message does nothing to explain to the user why it cannot be modified. This causes confusion and frustration, especially when trying to figure out what is causing the module to be disabled.

Steps to reproduce:
* Add the "Assign the issue to the lead developer" post function to a project. Basically this function assigns the ticket to the component lead. In this test, I added the post function to Resolve issue transition. 
* Create two components for a project
* Assign different users for the Component Lead
!component_1.jpg|thumbnail!
* Create an issue and associate it to both components
!component_2.jpg|thumbnail!
* Resolve the issue and see who will be the Assignee of the ticket.
!component_3.jpg|thumbnail!
!component_4.jpg|thumbnail!

h6. Additional Information:
* Regardless of the order of the component that you select (eg, you selected banana first and then apple), it always picks up the Component Lead of Apple.
* I also have tested to interchange the Component Lead for banana and apple (apple-danny, banana-admin), but once you resolved the ticket, it will be assigned to user "danny" who is the component lead for apple. Somehow, it only picks up the component alphabetically. 
* When there is no component lead for apple and user "danny" is the component lead for banana, it automatically assigns the issue to the project lead upon resolving the ticket. Again, the second component has been disregarded.
fields.summary: Component field only picking up the first Component specified in a Project and Ignoring the next one

When the Resolution field is hidden for a project, the "Recently Created Issue Report" is showing the correct details. However, when you check it from the issue navigator, it shows no issue. You will wonder where the chart is getting it's data as the issue navigator is showing no issues. it is confusing for the users if the data being shown are not in sync. 

h6. Steps to reproduce:
* Hide the Resolution field for a specific project.
* Generate a "Recently Created Issues Report". it will show you how many issues are unresolved/resolved vs created when you hover the mouse on the graph.
* Click on the graph and it will direct you to the issue navigator

h6. Expected Behavior:
The graph should show no resolved issues as the field resolution is hidden. Issue navigator is behaving as expected.

h6. Actual Behavior:
When you hover the mouse on the graph, it shows certain number of issues but when you click on the graph, it will direct you to the issue navigator which shows no issue (as the Resolution field is hidden). 
!bug_1.jpg|thumbnail!
!bug_2.jpg|thumbnail!

Additional Information:
* The above use case *only* happens when the Resolution field is hidden. issue navigator and Report are giving correct data if the resolution field is present.
fields.summary: Recently Created Issues Report vs Issue navigator if the Resolution Field is Hidden

Currently, even if a user is not logged into JIRA, he/she will still be able to access the _Issue Navigator_ using the URL: http://<JIRA_URL>/issues/?jql=/.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Setup a JIRA instance.
# Try to go to the _Issue Navigator_ URL (for example: http://localhost:8080/issue/?jql=)
# Even if you are not logged in, you will still be able to see the issue navigator.

There are customers who share their filters with everyone, and having the Issue Navigator URL publicly accessible allows for any user to browse those filters and see the filter owner name, for instance.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40782].
  {panel}

The way custom field description hierarchy is handled within JIRA seems to be counter-intuitive to some of our customers.
Examples below:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/62727/jira-v5-strange-custom-field-behavior
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/47433/how-to-update-custom-field-description
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/61711/custom-field-description-not-displayed
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13046/custom-field-descriptions-not-displaying-correctly

Perhaps we can find a way to clarify the hierarchy with the field configuration to customers that are editing on creating a description to a custom field.

Our documentation states:
{quote} 
Changing the description of a custom field

Not changing the description in a field configuration means that any changes you make to a custom field's description are not seen.

JIRA allows you to define a description of a custom field, and if the field configuration descriptions are left empty then the original description text will appear when you create or edit an issue, and as help text in the Issue Navigator. However you can also define different description texts in each field configuration and this will override the original field description text.

For example if a custom field "My Field" is defined with a description of "This is my field" and no field configuration changes are made, then the displayed text will be "This is my field" as expected. If field configurations are used and a description "This is my excellent field" is set for the custom field in the field description, then the displayed text will be "This is my excellent field". 
{quote}
fields.summary: Editing a Custom Field description does not update due to being overwritten by the Field Configuration

  {panel}

Most email clients add a 'In-Reply-To: <messageid>' header, when replying to a message. This allows the client to keep track of mail threads. It would be nice if JIRA added this header to email notifications, so that all mails relating to a certain issue would be grouped in a thread. In established projects, 80% of the traffic is bug reports and updates, and such a feature would make a big difference.

----

This is a duplicate of JRA-1113 from 2003, which was closed because it was "incorporated" into JRA-2326, which had no changes since 2009.

This is request is a simple feature. There is no need to wait for a super huge email integration issue just to get better mail handling.
fields.summary: Add threading to notification emails

fields.description:
as mentionned by JIRA-38646, the exact same problem still occurs, depending of the content of your database at the moment you start the upgrade of Jira !!!
This bug is NOT specific to MS SQL Server, and we reproduced it with Oracle 11g.
We reproduced it during upgrade of our PROD evnironment, but the bug did not occurs during the repetition on our DEV environment!!
Upgrade of DEV env worked fine... And we almost had to rollback our production release late in the evening .... until we dicovered a workaround!

WORKAROUND:
comment the section for the culprit class com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6304 in file  atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/upgrades.xml

{code}
 <!-- JIRA 6.3 -->
    <upgrade build="6301">
        <class>com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6301</class>
    </upgrade>
<!--
    <upgrade build="6302">
        <class>com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6302</class>
    </upgrade>
-->
    <upgrade build="6304">
        <class>com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6304</class>
    </upgrade>

fields.description:
At [Connecting JIRA to HSQLDB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+HSQLDB] states "These instructions will help you connect JIRA to a PostgreSQL database. A version of these instructions specific to Linux and JIRA is available."

This should be changed to:
These instructions will help you connect JIRA to an [HSQL|http://www.hsqldb.org] database.

Affects all JIRA 6 documentation versions.  I changed it for JIRA + JIRA063 but I'm unable to edit pages in spaces for versions older than JIRA063.

Here are the places it needs to be fixed I could find: [JIRA062|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Connecting+JIRA+to+HSQLDB], [JIRA061|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA061/Connecting+JIRA+to+HSQLDB], [JIRA060|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Connecting+JIRA+to+HSQLDB]

Cheers,
Morg.
fields.summary: Incorrect reference to PostgreSQL, should be HSQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40755].
  {panel}

In [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Tuning+Database+Connections#TuningDatabaseConnections-settings] the "recommendation" column states "This value should always be 'false' as JIRA borrows a connection for each database operation."

The adjacent "default" column lists the default value as "true".  WAT?

Which is truthier?

Cheers,
Morg.
fields.summary: Conflicting information regarding use of pool-test-on-borrow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40754].
  {panel}

In [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Tuning+Database+Connections#TuningDatabaseConnections-settings] it states "If you specify a Validation Query above, then you should specify a value for the Validation Query Timeout too."

However, in [Surviving Connection Closures|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Surviving+Connection+Closures] it says "(!) This should only be done for MySQL" and "(!) If the Validation Query Timeout is used on any database other than MySQL it will cause significant problems with the JIRA instance."

Which is truthier?  The other should be updated to match.

Cheers,
Morg.
fields.summary: Information regarding use of validation-query-timeout is not consistent.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40751].
  {panel}

Hi,
              The problem is that as admins we can't control user's sharing choices, if they choose to share a filter to Everyone, anonymous users can see filter names, even with Jira running in Private mode. Many filter names contains user names and / or confidential data on them, this is a critical  security issue/bug.

There should be an option to disable 'All users' as a possible sharing option, limiting it to Group or Project, or adding another choice, like  'Logged in users') instead of 'All users'.

Thanks in advance,
fields.summary: Disable 'All users' as a possible sharing option for filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40750].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new Jira issue in Safari
# Start editing the Description field.
# Type some letters representing a word that autocorrect wants to turn into another word, but that you want to keep as you typed it. For example, type “ouzza”, which autocorrect should try to correct to “huzza”.
# Press the [esc] key to dismiss the autocorrect suggestion without accepting it.

h3. Current behaviour

The autocorrect is dismissed but the field itself also loose focus.

h3. Expected behaviour

Only dismiss the auto correct.
fields.summary: Safari removes focus from field when using auto correcting
Moving issues between projects should trigger a warning if the field value will be deleted
Provide an option for moving subtasks to the same Fix Version that the parent changed to

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If using JNDI Datasource for the database of an instance, along with Tomcat 7, then the Database Monitoring section will have blank results

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Set up an instance using JNDI Datasource with Tomcat 7
# Once done, check the Database Monitoring page. It will show something like this :
!db monitor.png|thumbnail!
There are no values at all, while the read/write section has values

h3. Additional Info

Just to compare, once the same instance is changed to use the usual database configuration in the {{dbconfig.xml}}, this is the result in the Database Monitor :

!db monitor2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Using Tomcat 7 with JNDI datasource causes the Database Monitoring to have no results

fields.description:
1. Setup incoming mail in JIRA
2. Setup attachment size to some value (for example 1024=1KB)
3. Setup mail handler to create or comment existing issue
3. Send an email with attachment larger than the limit (>1KB)

Result:
Mail handlers creates issue attachment ignoring the size limit. Whole file is attached.

Expected result:
Attachment size limit is respected by mail handler.
fields.summary: Mail handler ignores attachment size limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40737].
  {panel}

Assume companyA has an LDAP A and JIRA A instance while companyB has an LDAP B and JIRA B instance. 

CompanyB buys over companyA and adds all users into LDAP B. However, the username is different than LDAP A

CompanyB then asks companyA to migrate their projects from JIRA A to JIRA B

Migrating projects to the new instance will cause complications in terms of mapping to the old username
fields.summary: Remap users to a different LDAP directory with different username

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40736].
  {panel}

We had to add some technical jira-Accounts to optimize dispatching workflows and our controlling dashboards.

These accounts are team users, which are only used to assign jiras to a team. (Users email-adress is a mailing list, team account or team leaders account.)

We can't dispatch jiras by projects and assignee is a mandatory field due to other rules in our workflow.

Can you please add the possibility to add users, which can't login to Jira and exclude these account from the list of users under license control.

With this option you can easily build team queues and canban like dashboards.

Regards,
  Petra Pensky
fields.summary: add technical users, which are not under license control

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40733].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in July
# Create an issue in August
# Set the period of gadget to month.
# View the average age gadget in September
(i) We can change the date of machine when reproduce this problem

h4. Expected Behaviour
The total numbers in August should include the average of unresolved issues created in July and August

h4. Actual Behaviour
The total numbers in August only include the average of unresolved issues created in July or before July.
fields.summary: Incorrect Calculation in Average Age Gadget

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40732].
  {panel}

I can't do anything except Esc out of the screen.  See below for screenshot.

Steps to reproduce:

# Go to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-5461?filter=32650&jql=project%20%3D%20STASH%20and%20text%20~%20%22oauth%22%20order%20by%20created

# Select the "Stash" project
# Select "Bug"

It may depend on my permissions... but I can reproduce this every time.  If I change to "Suggestion" type, I get the buttons back.

Interestingly, the problem disappears if I remove the "order by created" from the query. 

!http://monosnap.com/image/P6hCUO1G1Ht4SLkbREyt8aMxBnvSws.png!

Commit [87e036b17e5a9aabd1cbf6ee3528c2cdf814b3a7|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira/commits/87e036b17e5a9aabd1cbf6ee3528c2cdf814b3a7] for JDEV-24213 and JDEV-24225 changed a constructor in {{jira-core}} as follows:

{code}
@@ -56,11 +55,12 @@ public abstract class AbstractDateRangeSearcher extends AbstractInitializationCu

             final ApplicationProperties applicationProperties, final VelocityTemplatingEngine templatingEngine,

-            final JqlDateSupport dateSupport, final TimeZoneManager timeZoneManager)

One plugin having a broken custom field taking down search/view issue for everyone is not a great situation.  I think this exception should be caught in DefaultCustomFieldManager.CustomFieldCache.cloneCustomFields and the field should just be omitted from the results.  The impact should be morally equivalent to the plugin just being disabled, which would also make the custom field unavailable.
fields.summary: DefaultCustomFieldManager.CustomFieldCache.cloneCustomFields is too fragile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40719].
  {panel}

Extending [JRA-22417|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22417], if an user in JIRA does not receive notifications for an Issue Updated Event but does for Issue Commented, if there's any comments added during the update JIRA should send the notification for Issue Commented. 

h4. Example:
UserA isn't a recipient of the *Issue Updated* event, but is of the *Issue Commented.
\\
* *Current Behavior:* If a comment is added when editing an issue, UserA will not receive any notifications (neither from the Updated Fields nor the Comment).

* *Desired Behavior:* If a comment is added when editing an issue, UserA would receive a 'Comment Added' notification.
fields.summary: Send Issue Commented notification if notification is not sent for Issue Updated
Go to the last page on Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40715].
  {panel}

*Description*
Administrators should have the ability to modify what a user will see when they select a project.

As it stands, even if a user is assigned only one issue in a Project, they can still see the Summary, Issues, Calendar, Components, Labels and Agile tabs on the Project's Dashboard. They can also see Reports and all activity associated with the Project.

This feature would allow the administrator to only allow them to view single Issues, rather than the other information associated with that Project.
fields.summary: Project Dashboard View Permissions

fields.description:
When importing a csv file with a field that has a user's full name, the field is left unassigned once the import completes even though that user's full name exists within JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- go to the Issues dropdown, select import issues from CSV
- upload a test csv file with a column that uses full names
- map the csv field to an appropriate JIRA field ex. assignee
- complete import

h3. Intended Results
A user is mapped to the assignee field based on their full name.

h3. Actual Results
the associated issue is left unassigned

h3. Workaround
To map user's, the csv file must use usernames instead of full names.
fields.summary: Full Name Doesn't Import Correctly With JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM)
